--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "Philip Tucker" <tucker0171@y...> wrote:
> Hello all,
> 
> Derek and I are signing up for the June GECCO conference in
Seattle.  I
> assume other members of this group are going, too.  Does anyone have
> recommendations for any of the tutorials or workshops they are
offering?  It
> looks like there's only one on neural networks.
> 
> - Philip


Yeah the guy giving the NN tutorial is Xin Yao, who is famous for his
1999 pre-NEAT paper on neuroevolution, "Evolving Neural Networks,"
which was and probably still is the most comprehensive review of the
field.  But unfortunately at least in past years it looks like his
tutorial is mostly from that era, so it's missing a lot of the recent
developments in the field like NEAT.  (Of course this year could be
different.)  Still, I recommend checking it out since he's a well
known researcher and his perspective may be useful.

I think the big topic this year in workshops will be indirect
encoding.  It's a really interesting open area and starting to
interest a lot of people.  There are several workshops on this type of
thing:

-Regeneration and Learning in Developmental Systems
-Self-Organization on Representations for Genetic and Evolutionary
Algorithms

And probably the most interesting one:

-Modularity, regularity and hierarchy in open-ended evolutionary
computation

I also find interactive evolutionary computation promising and
interesting, and there's a workshop for that too:

-Interactive Evolutionary Computing


ken
